title: ALB Path-Based Session Stickiness
description: Deploy an Application Load Balancer with path-based session stickiness using AWS CDK.

introBox.headline: How it works
text: This sample project demonstrates how to set up an Application Load Balancer (ALB) with path-based session stickiness using AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK). The ALB routes traffic to different target groups based on the request path.

The project creates a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with public and private subnets, an ALB, and two target groups (one for each path). It also deploys two Lambda functions, each associated with a different target group.

When a client sends a request to a specific path (e.g., /app1), the ALB forwards the request to the corresponding target group and Lambda function. Subsequent requests from the same client session are routed to the same target group, ensuring session stickiness.
See the GitHub repo for detailed testing instructions.
